pages.text: If by some miracle I manage to acquire one of these dragon eggs from an adult female $(l:slayers_journal/beastiary/dragon)dragon$(), I might think of raising a dragon for myself.$(br2)Fire and ice dragon eggs hatching procedures are different, though they will both take a long time to hatch.

Fire dragon eggs need to be placed in a strong consistent heat source in order to hatch properly.$(br2)For ice dragon eggs, these need to be placed submerged in water where it will freeze over before hatching.$(br2)I had read in some manuscripts that young dragons are extremely loyal to their parents because of their strong maternal instincts, so I

need to make sure I take very good care of them by feeding them properly. Older dragons will also hunt nearby livestock if hungry as well.$(br2)Because of the ancient nature of dragons, they take an exceptionally long time to mature.$(br2)Fortunately I found a way to accelerate their growth is by feeding them $(item)dragon meal$() which will increase their growth by one day.

If the dragon is old enough, it will be able to be mounted and flown around as well as be able to execute attack commands.$(br2)A $(item)dragon command staff$() can be used on a dragon to order it to stay in one place or wander.$(br2)When the tamed dragon is too high up in the air, a $(item)dragon bone flute$() may be used to call it down to the ground.

Two adult dragons can also be bred with a certain elemental lily mixture; either a $(item)fire lily mixture$() or a $(item)frost lily mixture$().$(br2)The male dragon should be fed first before feeding the female dragon with the substance; the female will create a nest with a single egg of any color afterwards.
